name: ITP008 - Lime Stabilisation Works
template name: ITP008 - Lime Stabilisation Works - Rev A

name: 1.0 - Preliminary Activities – Permits, Documentation, Approvals, Materials and Trials
Acceptance Criteria - Current revision drawing is being used including the subcontractors copy. Current Revision to be obtained via Aconex
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Acceptance Criteria - All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP
Reference Documents - PSP, EMP, TMP, WP, SWMS
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - An Excavation Permit and an Isolation permit issued by Melbourne Airport. Fulton Hogan Excavation permit issued to plant operators.
Acceptance Criteria - Review ITP004 (Select Fill placement) and ITP003 (Stripping and bulk out) has been completed to a satisfactory level
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Test Pits have taken for the works area and suitable lime content parameters have been established. Test Pits should be taken at least one month prior to works beginning
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Stabilised Lime subgrade material shall have a minimum of lime content of 4% and a specified minimum strength of 20% CBR after 7 days of curing.
Record of conformity - Test results & This ITP signed

Acceptance Criteria - Trial of the Lime Stabilised Subgrade is greater than 500m2 to demonstrate that the Subgrade is able to meet the required specification. If trial is approved and accepted by Principal’s Representative. Tried Lime Stabilised Subgrade will form the completed Works. Principal’s Representative to approve trial before commencing Lime Stabilised Subgrade placing.
Record of conformity - This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria - Inspect subgrade that will require lime stabilisation.
○ Subgrade that is excessively wet and/or contains rocks greater than 60mm to 100mm, subgrade will need to be removed and replaced with site won material.
○ No testing or proof rolls required on replaced subgrade
○ Survey to for any excessive high and/or low spots. Fill / excavate spots as required.
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Prior to spreading lime, the subgrade is to be ripped and pulverised to at least 300mm to 400mm
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Summary of Layer Parameters:
○ A Lot is defined as one days production
○ Min depth of 300mm for PT01, PT03, PT08
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Check weather forecast for rain and wind. Works to not beginning if rain is imminent. Works must not start or cease if wind increase over 15 knots
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Lime to be spread uniformly over the prepared surface at the Lime spreading rate calculated.
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Lime spread to be checked every hour and shall be with +/- 5% of the specified amount. An area to be checked is required to be 1x1m2.
Acceptance Criteria - All lime to be mixed to the specified depth within 8 hours of spreading. Mixing passes to overlap to ensure subgrade is mixed twice as a minimum.
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Approximately every hour, mixing plant will record the depth of application to check compliance with the specification (300mm or 400mm).
Acceptance Criteria - Construction Joints when required, will be placed to ensure no single plane of weakness. Construction joints of adjacent lots will:
○ Longitudinal Joints – Will be avoided by overlapping adjacent lime stabilisation mixing runs.
○ Traverse Joints – Will be staggered to avoid forming a single joint.
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - After satisfactory mixing, compaction shall commence within two hours and be finished within eight hours of mixing completion. Additional moisture may be added if required.
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Surface to be trimmed to +0mm, -25mm
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - As soon as lime stabilisation activities start, no construction plant to travel across works zone (other than those involved in the operation for 48 hours minimum.
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Curing shall commence as soon as practical. The curing period is 48 hours or until the succeeding layer is placed.
Record of conformity - This signed ITP

Acceptance Criteria - Following completion of the curing period, detailed trim and survey conformance, the Principle’s Representative will be invited to a proof roll (24 hours notice). Proof roll will be accepted if no rutting greater than 25mm is observed. Proof roll will involve using a heavy vibrating roller (in static mode)
Record of conformity - This signed ITP
Acceptance Criteria - Long straight edge surface not to deviate by more than 12mm over a 3m long straight edge, following subgrade treatment
Record of conformity - This signed ITP Results Attached
Acceptance Criteria - To exceed 20% CBR after 7 days. Test every 1500m2 for first 3 consecutive conforming Lots; then every 3,000m2 or part there of. Maximum 3 tests per lot.
Record of conformity - This signed ITP Results Attached
Acceptance Criteria - Maximum Dry Density used is lime stabilised subgrade 90%. 500m2 for first 3 consecutive conforming Lots; then every 1000m2 or part there of. Maximum 4 test per Lot
Record of conformity - This signed ITP Results Attached
Acceptance Criteria - Stabilised and compacted subgrade surface layer to comply within -25mm to +0mm from specified levels.
Record of conformity - This signed ITP Results Attached

On behalf of Fulton Hogan, it is hereby certified that the Works represented by the items of work listed have been tested in accordance with the Project Quality Plan and conform in all respects with the requirements of the Contract.
